executorResult - Variable in class br.com.armange.commons.thread.builder.AbstractThreadBuilder
 
ExecutorResult<T> - Class in br.com.armange.commons.thread.builder
A bean that encapsulates a thread result, composed of an ExecutorService, a Future list, and another ExecutorResult list for timed threads.
The ExecutorResult list will be present when some thread has a timeout.
A Future object will be present by each thread started.
Consider seeing the logical relationship between ExecutorService and Future in their respective documentation.
ExecutorResult - Class in br.com.armange.commons.thread
Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
Consider to use ExecutorResult A bean that wrappes a thread result, composed by a ExecutorService, a Future list and another ExecutorResult list for timeouted threads.
The ExecutorResult list will be present when some thread has a timeout.
One Future will be present by each thread started.
Consider seeing the logical relationship between ExecutorService and Future in their respective documentation.
ExecutorResult(ExecutorService) - Constructor for class br.com.armange.commons.thread.builder.ExecutorResult

H

handleException(Holder<F>) - Method in class br.com.armange.commons.thread.builder.AbstractThreadBuilder
Returns a lambda that handles exceptions caught on the thread.
If the thread has not been canceled and there are no exceptions, and if there is a consumer for the thread's result, it will be executed.
If the thread has thrown an exception, and if the thread has not been configured to silence exceptions, it will be handled according to the exception's consumer (if configured previously).

T

ThreadBuilder - Class in br.com.armange.commons.thread.builder
Class responsible for simplifying and speeding up the creation and configuration of threads.
The implementation of threads can be simplified using one of the four classes below.
CommonRunnableThreadBuilder: To implement threads that run tasks but do not need to return values after execution.
ThreadBuilder - Class in br.com.armange.commons.thread
Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
Consider to use ThreadBuilder Useful structure for thread creation in the following scenarios:
  • Timeout

    The thread will be active only until the timeout be fired.

  • Delay

    The thread will be active only after the time delay be completed.

  • Interval

    The thread will be repeated after the time interval be completed.

  • Exception handling

    Handles of uncaught exceptions can be thrown and handled within threads.

Note:
The thread will wait a minimum delay (ThreadBuilder.MINIMAL_REQUIRED_DELAY) if and only if a (ThreadBuilder.setAfterExecuteConsumer(BiConsumer)) or a (ThreadBuilder.setUncaughtExceptionConsumer(Consumer)) is present. 
 Example:

 final ExecutorService thread = ThreadBuilder
          .newBuilder() //New object to build a new thread.
          .setDelay(1000) //The thread will wait one second before start.
          .setTimeout(4000) //The thread will be canceled after four seconds.
          .setInterval(1000) //The thread will be repeated every second.
          .setAfterExecuteConsumer(afterExecuteConsumer) //A consumer will be called after thread execution.
          .setUncaughtExceptionConsumer(throwableConsumer) //A consumer will be called after any exception thrown.
          .setMayInterruptIfRunning(true) //The thread interruption/cancellation will not wait execution.
          .setSilentInterruption(true) //Interruption and Cancellation exceptions will not be thrown.
          .setExecution(anyRunnable) //The thread execution.
          .setThreadNameSupplier(() -> "Thread name")
          .setThreadPrioritySupplier(() -> 4)
          .start();
threadFactory - Variable in class br.com.armange.commons.thread.builder.AbstractThreadBuilder
 
threadNameSupplier - Variable in class br.com.armange.commons.thread.builder.AbstractThreadBuilder

ThreadUtil - Class in br.com.armange.commons.thread
Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
Consider to use ThreadUtil Useful structure for handling the current segment. Some methods that require handling a checked exception are rewritten in this class, however, throwing an unchecked exception.

tryAsync(ResourcesConsumer, Closeable...) - Static method in class br.com.armange.commons.thread.async.ResourcesTryAsyncBuilder
Generates a new thread builder to configure its operations simulating a try-with-resources implementation.
tryAsync(ResourcesConsumer, Closeable...) - Static method in class br.com.armange.commons.thread.async.TryAsyncBuilder
It creates a new thread builder that supports creating threads that are structured to simulate a try-with-resources block code.
The try-with-resources block will be simulated through a thread that will execute a consumer receiving a closeable object as a parameter.
tryAsync(RunnableWithException) - Static method in class br.com.armange.commons.thread.async.RunnableTryAsyncBuilder
Creates a thread builder.

It creates a new thread builder that supports creating threads that are structured to simulate a try-catch block code.

It creates a new thread builder that supports creating threads that are structured to simulate a try-with-resources block code.
The try-with-resources block will be simulated through a thread that will execute a consumer receiving a closeable object as a parameter.

TryAsyncBuilder - Class in br.com.armange.commons.thread.async
It is a thread builder that assists in creating structured threads to simulate a set of try-catch-finally or try-with-resources blocks.

UncheckedException - Exception in br.com.armange.commons.thread.exception
Unchecked exceptions can be thrown instead of the RuntimeException option to release the handling of exceptions when they do not need to be handled.
UncheckedException - Exception in br.com.armange.commons.thread
Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
Consider to use UncheckedException Unchecked exceptions can be thrown instead of the RuntimeException option to release the handling of exceptions when they do not need to be handled.

The constructor will only call SUPER method (RuntimeException#RuntimeException(Throwable))
